string.text: I got your message. What's the problem?
There's this sniper positioned on the bridge up ahead and he keeps shooting down anyone that passes by. Bastard's good too - he doesn't miss.
How can we get rid of the sniper?

Shoot him, of course! Problem is getting in a good position and having the proper weapon. There is a AK in the green house, in the village up ahead. If you sneak by using junk as cover, you might be able to get a clean shot and down the bastard.
I'll take care of it.
Hey stalker, well its all much better since someone killed that damn sniper on the bridge.
Yeah, it wasn't that hard, he never even saw me coming.
So, it was you! Thank you, stalker, we are indebted to you, please accept this token of our appreciation and consider me a friend.
Thank you, that's very kind. See you around, friend.
You said you have a reward for me?
Yep, here, all yours for a job well done.
Thank you, much appreciated. See you around.
Hey, how's it going?
What the hell happened?! I thought you were going to take care of it?
Sorry, I got side-tracked and never managed to get that sniper.
Well, thanks to you the bandits have taken over our old camp and are threatening to occupy the whole area!
Like I said, I`m sorry. Good to see you guys are ok and the sniper seems to have left. Catch you later.
Damn, where were you when we needed some help?
I`ve been around, how goes things?
Well, things are not good, we put out a call for help a while back and no one answered and now the bandits are taking over our old camp and are threatening to occupy the whole area!
Sorry to hear. Good to see you guys are ok. Catch you later maybe.
Tell me about yourself.

Bes is my name. I came to these parts three years ago. Like many of the guys in the Zone, I ain't got a pretty past - I'm a fugitive, wanted for two murders and GBH. A few years ago a friend of mine got battered pretty bad. They had to literally stitch him back together at the hospital. So I paid the bastards who did it a little "visit". When the coppers showed up, I had to shoot one of them and jump out of a third-floor window. I've been here since. I've done well in this place but the list of my crimes has got a little longer too. I try to fight the lawless just as I did on the outside. I train up rookies and teach them to survive in the Zone.
Don't you think you should join a faction if you want to fight crime - Duty or otherwise?

Duty fights against the Zone; Freedom for free access to the Zone. They're opposites that create friction and trouble for Loners that set their own morals and don't abide by clan rules. To me, as a stalker, I fight for the people - nothing else. Besides, certain elements of Duty are in cahoots with the government and Army. I don't want to wake up in a cold cell one day.
Good luck to you.
What's this place?

The Garbage. We are right at home here. You see the heaps of crap? You don't want to go there, trust me. So full of radioactive waste, the Geiger counters go off the scale. This is the only decent way into the Zone and bandits have been increasingly active here lately. They're shit scared of going deeper into the Zone, into Duty territory, like experienced stalkers. But those hyenas just love robbing the rookies here. So, if nobody else cares, we have to stand our ground and fight ourselves.
Go on.
Everywhere, and especially here, you gotta act like a human being, not like some greed-driven animal. That's my outlook on life.
Are there any notable landmarks in the Garbage?

We're at the abandoned cranes, a little further is a ruined building, then past that is where the junk piles start extending throughout the area. The main road should lead you to the hangar and vehicle graveyard, then the Duty checkpoint. Usually it's pretty quiet there since Duty are anti-mutant zealots. If worse comes to worse, you can spend the night in the hangar with Seriy's boys.
Thank you.
Thanks, I don't need anything from you right now.
I know quite a lot, I could share some information with you.
The job ain't done. Let's finish it and talk later.
Hey, Marked One.
Thanks to your help, we've got control over the hangar and Garbage again. You've really helped us, Marked One. I hear from Sido that you're looking for info about Strelok. Am I right?
Yes, Sidorovich told me about you, so I came for a chat. Got anything for me?

OK dude, you helped me and my boys out for free, so I'll tell you what I know. One of the guys at the Agroprom - a friend of mine, a "digger" called Mole - is waiting for me. He dug up Strelok's stash and I think he found something. Here are the coordinates of our meeting place. Tell him I sent you since I couldn't be there.
Thanks for the information.
Damn that was close!
What the hell were you thinking?? The instructions were clear, WAIT for my signal!
Look, I`m sorry, I don't know what came over me.

You're a dangerous stalker for sure! I believe you are looking for information about Strelok. One of the guys at the Agroprom - a friend of mine, a "digger" called Mole - is waiting for me. He dug up Strelok's stash and I think he found something. Here are the coordinates of our meeting place. Go now before you get someone killed!
Thanks, I appreciate it and sorry again.
Listen, what's up with this place, the Garbage?

Quick and dirty trouble with a side of heavy rad from the junk hills. Far better for rookies to stay in the Cordon and deal with the grunts, but since you're such an explorer, I'll tell you what I know. East of us is the vehicle scrapyard, with tons of filth and zombies waiting for a sucker to barge in. You probably already know about the Duty checkpoint up North that leads to the 100 Rads Bar. West is Agroprom, and further East past the scrapyard is the Dark Valley - place of death if you ask me. The Monolith and bandits control that area and weird stuff goes on there. That's all I know about these parts.
Thanks for the info. I'll keep it in mind.
I can see you're upset by something. What happened?

Yeah, there's one problem... while I fended off the bandits here at the Garbage, my friend got lost. I want to go search for him, but there's almost no info. They say he and some other guy were sent to wipe out the zombies in some village. There is a lot of such villages in the Zone, but - as far as I understand - that village's either at the Warehouses or in the Forest. I'll search for him there. And I wonder if you could help me with that?
You want me to help you search? Yeah, I will.
Great! Then I'll head to the Warehouses and you go to the Forest. I've sent the village's coordinates to your PDA.
Alright. I'll tell you if I find something.
Thanks a lot.
I've found your friend - he was in the Forest. Got him out of the zombie village and led to the safe place.
Great news. You've met up my expectations! I was already planning my trip to the Forest to find him. Where is he now?
I've led him to the Duty outpost, and he stayed there. He wanted to go to the Bar. Don't know the other details.
What happened to him, though?
His partner robbed him and left him with no equipment in the zombie village. There's no info on that guy, not even the name.
Alright, I won't let the prick go away easy! Thanks a lot, I won't forget what you've done for us. Here, take what I have.
Can you tell me anything about this place?

Well, listen, everywhere you look it's a big stinking dump. After the accident in 1986, they brought radioactive waste, cranes, and all the destroyed machinery here. Basically, it's full of useless crap and a few anomalies here and there. You can even find some artifacts, but they're not spectacular so that's why you'll mostly find rookies in this place. Lots of rookies means lots of bandits, so it's best not to hang around too long. Go North and you'll eventually a Great Metal Factory and the 100 Rads Bar. Furthermore, to the East is the Dark Valley, a gloomy place. To the West is the Agroprom Research Institute. I'll mark safe pathways on your map.

Good, help at last! Our leader, Seriy, is going to draw the attention of the bandits in the hangar. Meanwhile, we sneak our way around and shoot - take them by surprise y'know. Hopefully they won't see it coming. You game?
Sure, I'll follow your lead.
Good, we'll sneak up and wait for the signal.
Right behind you.
Thanks for the help stalker, but I'm afraid you can't go any further!
Why?

Because beyond that gate is our territory - Duty territory - and we're very picky about who we let through. If you don't have anything important to discuss with our leaders, you ain't getting past here.
I see.
Those are the rules.
I'll be back!
But I have to go through!
Well... you can pay for it, but it's not cheap - 20 grand.
That's much, but it's worth it.
Pleasure doing business with you! Alright, you can go through now.
I don't have such money.
Well, there's nothing I can do then. But actually... there's a lot of mutants here - why should we wait until they attack? Go kill some boars and fleshes. We'll talk then.
I'll get it done.
But I need to pass. I have some business with the Barkeep. They call me Marked One.
Ah yes, Barkeep told us about you. Ok you can pass.
Thanks, see you around.
Thanks for helping us fighting off the boars. Take a well deserved reward.
Thanks!
You know the rules!
Yeah, yeah, I'm leaving!
Say hi to the Barkeep from me when you see him. Beware though, mutants will be on the path to the Bar.
Sure, OK.
Have you killed the boars yet?!
No. I'll be back in a minute.
Have you killed the mutants?
Not yet, but I'm still working on it.
Yeah, they're dead.
That's better! You can go through now. Say hello to Barkeep!
Not yet, but I have to pass. I have urgent business with Barkeep - name's Marked One.
Hey, stalker, I have a proposition for you.
Yeah, what is it?

You a fan of lil' luck games? I have three medkits here: one red, one blue and one yellow. Two of the medkits contain a poison, the other will heal Caesar back to his good ol' self! If you pick the one that heals him, I will give you 10,000 RU, but if you pick either with the poison... well then you know what happens. Your call.
This is sick, I'm out of here! I really can't fathom why the hell you are doing this...
Sure, let's do this...
OK, so which do you choose: red, blue or yellow? Remember, two of them will kill him; the other will save him.
I choose red.
I choose blue.
I choose yellow.
Then go and give it to him and let's see what happens!
Alright.
Well, what are you waiting for, go and give it to him!
OK, OK.
Well done, stalker! here is the 10,000 RU I promised. thanks for playing our little game!
Yeah... I hope to never see either of you again. I'm going now...
Ah, good, you're back! So, are we going to do this or what?
Hey stalker, stay safe.
Yeah, thanks.
Stalker, please... I need a medkit, hurry...
Uh, Brutus gave me this. Take it!
Stalker, please... I need a medkit, hurry...
Uh, Brutus gave me this. Take it!
Wow man, that was intense! You chose the right one. You win! Go see Brutus for your reward.
You guys are sick!
Help... please... I... need... a... medkit...
Take it easy, let me speak to your friend here and see what's going on.
Hey, thanks again for the help. You have sick moves bro!
Sure, it was my, er, pleasure!

So here you are - one of Duty's attack dogs. You were sent for negotiations? Hah, let's get the ball rolling... We need a rare artifact called "Goldfish" for our experiments. If you can get it for us, maybe we'll return what we snatched from you.
I will do it.
Hurry up, doggy! I won't wait forever.
I don't have time to deal with this bullshit. Die.
Do you have anything for me?
Not yet. I'm still searching.
Then what you are doing here? I want this artifact now! Find it and get it, you stupid dog!
Yes, here it is.

He-he, Veles will be happy. We don't need any services from you and your idiotic clan anymore - too much trouble for us. We needed this for our special genetic project... Hmph, not like you can understand anyway. Huh, wait, what the is that!
What?
Voronin sent me to you.

Good, right on time Major. We already know about the situation. Our military sources have confirmed that Sin's base is deep in the mines. Our strike team is ready to get rid of these bastards once and for all! We can't allow anyone to trifle with Duty! We are the strength, law, and order in this cesspool! I marked on your minimap the position where we will start our assault. Let's get to work! See you soon, Marked One.
Good luck, guys.
Thank you mate, I thought I would never leave here alive. Lucky for me you were close.
Never good to be wandering alone, I can guide you somewhere if you need?
No, don't worry, I can take it from here. I can't thank you enough for saving my life, so please, take this artifact, I hope it will be useful to you!
Thanks. Be careful out there! Bye.
